that's not normal. Are you sure your /etc/hosts is okay?
I have no idea what /etc/hosts even does, to be frank.
it associates IP addresses with names. The first line should read "127.0.0.1 localhost", the second should show your LAN IP and hostname. Here, it's "192.168.1.18 piano" for example.
http://pastebin.com/d29b4cbb5 This is after the two 127.0.-something addresses.
if that second line is wrong or missing, you get delays at login
Oh the second line is "127.0.1.1   [computer name] " Is that wrong?
By the way... We are talking about ubuntu booting slow, right?
no, /etc/hosts problems result in delays after password entry on gdm.
to tweak actual bootup times, you have to edit services.
